    Models¶

    algorithms.agglomerative.agglomerative_clustering(X: numpy.ndarray, K: int, fig_save_path: str = None)¶
    Run agglomerative clustering with six different combinations between:

    • Affinities: euclidean or cosine.

    • Linkages: complete, average, single.

    Parameters

    • X – 2D input data matrix of shape (#instances, #features).

    • K – Number of clusters.

    • fig_save_path – Whether to save or plot figure

    Returns

    List of clustering predictions with the corresponding affinity and linkage methods.

    class algorithms.kmeans.KMeans(K: int, name: str, max_it=1000, metric='euclidean', vis_dims=0, fig_save_path: str = None, seed=1)¶
    _calculate_distances(X: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray¶

    Calculate distance from each point to each cluster :param X: 2D vector with the set of points of size (#observations, #features). :return: Distance matrix of shape (K, #observations)

    _display_iteration(X, nearest_idx)¶

    Visualize a plot for the current iteration centroids and point assignments. :param X: 2D vector with the set of points of size (instances, features). :param nearest_idx: List of size (K, ?) assigning each point to its nearest cluster.

    _distance(a: numpy.ndarray, b: numpy.ndarray) → float¶

    Compute distance between 2 elements using the specified metric. Check metrics in: https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.spatial.distance.cdist.html :param a: 1D vector with all A attributes. :param b: 1D vector with all B attributes. :return: Distance between both vectors using the specified metric.

    _get_nearest(X: numpy.ndarray, distances: numpy.ndarray) → Tuple[List[int], List[List[numpy.ndarray]], List[List[int]]]¶

    For each data instance :param X: 2D vector with the set of points of size (#observations, #features). :param distances: 2D vector of distances between centroids and observations. :return: Tuple containing:

    • Cluster indexes assigned to each observation.

    • List of nearest observations for each cluster.

    • List of nearest observations index for each cluster.

    _init_centroids()¶

    Initialize centroids

    fit_predict(X: numpy.ndarray) → List[int]¶

    Fit the model with provided data and return their assigned clusters. :param X: 2D data array of size (rows, features). :return: Cluster indexes assigned to each row of X.

    predict(X: numpy.ndarray) → Union[List[int], Tuple[List[int], numpy.ndarray]]¶

    Assign clusters to a list of observations. :param X: 2D data array of size (rows, features). :return: Cluster indexes assigned to each row of X.

    class algorithms.kmodes.KModes(K: int, name: str, max_it=1000, metric='euclidean', vis_dims=0, fig_save_path: str = None, seed=1)¶

    Bases: algorithms.kmeans.KMeans

    _distance(a: numpy.ndarray, b: numpy.ndarray) → float¶

    Compute distance between two points using Kronecker’s delta (1 if the values are equal, and 0 otherwise) :param a: 1D vector with all A attributes. :param b: 1D vector with all B attributes. :return: Distance (dissimilarity) between a and b.

    class algorithms.kprototypes.KPrototypes(cat_idx, gamma=1, **kwargs)¶

    Bases: algorithms.kmeans.KMeans

    _distance(a: numpy.ndarray, b: numpy.ndarray) → float¶
    Compute distance between two points using:

    • Categorical attributes: Kronecker’s delta (1 if the values are equal, and 0 otherwise).

    • Numerical attributes: Distance according to the specified metric in the instantiation.

    Parameters

    • a – 1D vector with all A attributes.

    • b – 1D vector with all B attributes.

    Returns

    Numerical attributes distance + gamma_factor * Categorical attributes distance.

    class algorithms.fcm.FuzzyCMeans(C: int, m: int, epsilon=0.01, **kwargs)¶

    Bases: algorithms.kmeans.KMeans

    _compute_centroids(*args)¶

    Update c-partition matrix U and centroids (centers of gravity) V. :param args: Ignored for inheritance interface design.

    _display_iteration(X, nearest_idx)¶

    Visualize a plot for the current iteration centroids and point assignments. :param X: 2D vector with the set of points of size (instances, features). :param nearest_idx: List of size (K, ?) assigning each point to its nearest cluster.

    _init_centroids()¶

    Initialize centroids (V) and c-partition matrix U

    _init_u()¶

    Initialize matrix U (K, n) with random values such that each column adds up to 1.

    _loss()¶
    Returns

    _update_v()¶

    Update centroids (centers of gravity) V. v_k = ∑_i ((U_ki ^ m) * x_i) / ∑_i (U_ki ^ m)

    Utils¶

    utils.dataset.read_dataset(name=None, dataset_path='datasets', verbose=False)¶

    Read datasets in format arff inside ./datasets folder. :param name: Name of the dataset, if None, reads all datasets. :param verbose: Display attributes of the read dataset. :return: Dataset[name] or list of datasets.

    utils.evaluate.normalized_partition_coefficient(u)¶
    Parameters

    u – membership matrix

    Returns

    normalized (range: [0,1] where 1 is hard) partition coeficient

    Note: # clusters = u.shape[0], # rows = u.shape[1]

    utils.evaluate.partition_entropy(u)¶
    Parameters

    u – membership matrix, with shape (# clusters, # rows)

    Returns

    partition entropy

    utils.optimize.optimize(X: numpy.ndarray, algorithm: Type[algorithms.kmeans.KMeans], algorithm_params: dict, metric: str, metric_params: dict, k_values: List[int], goal: str, precompute_distances: bool = False) → List[dict]¶

    Optimize K value for the same data, algorithm and metric. :param X: 2D data matrix of size (#observations, #features). :param algorithm: Algorithm class to instantiate. :param algorithm_params: Extra parameters for the algorithm class. :param metric: Metric function used to evaluate. :param metric_params: Extra parameters for the metric function. :param k_values: List of K values to test. :param goal: maximize or minimize the metric. :return: List sorted from best to worst K value also containing metric score and predictions obtained.

    utils.plotting.get_colors(n: int)¶

    Sample RGBA colors from HSV matplotlib colormap. :param n: Number of colors to obtain. :return: List of n RGBA colors.
